issue.title: Remove 'extern' keyword in OQS wrapper header files
issue.body:
Using 'extern' in the OQS algorithm wrapper header files isn't necessary for the keypair, encaps & decaps funcs.

```extern OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_[alg]_cca_std_keypair(uint8_t *public_key, uint8_t *secret_key);```
can be:
```OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_[alg]_cca_std_keypair(uint8_t *public_key, uint8_t *secret_key);```

issue.title: Updated code to OQS's KEM API.
issue.body: Updated code to use OQS's KEM API.

comment.body:
When I try to build this against the current master [493e5ec](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/commit/493e5ece376d7c70213271bbb54970aadd15b0e5), I get the following error:

```
crypto/ec/oqs_meth.c:277:29: error: no member named 'priv_key_len' in
      'struct OQS_SIG'
    int buflen = oqskey->s->priv_key_len + oqskey->s->pub_key_len, penclen;
```

Should I be building this against a version of master prior to when [#368](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/368) landed, e.g. [a237410](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/commit/a23741082bbb2222f05708f6da37b87f0797b47e)?  If so, we should update the README's `git clone` instruction to point to that commit until we are synced with the head of master.

issue.title: KAT checks not working right on master
issue.body:
There are several problems with the recently merged KAT checks on master:

1. Building on macOS without OpenSSL yields the following error.  This is because rand\_nist.c depends on OpenSSL, but we should be able to build liboqs master without OpenSSL.  So we need to selectively disable all relevant parts (rand\_nist, kat\_kem) when OpenSSL is not present.  Or we need to decide to require OpenSSL -- which would be something for discussion.

```
rand_nist.c:12:10: fatal error: 'openssl/conf.h' file not found
#include <openssl/conf.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

2. Several of the Travis build logs are showing error messages despite passing.  So there are actually two problems to fix here: (a) figure out why there are KAT errors in the logs and fix them, and (b) figure out why the Travis tests aren't failing due to the errors.  See:
    - https://travis-ci.org/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/jobs/424519384
    - https://travis-ci.org/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/jobs/424519385

comment.body: I'll check; there might have been a confusion with the multiple versions of OQS in my dev environment.

issue.title: Change SIG algorithm identifier on master to a string
issue.body:
Following approach on nist-branch.

Also, should we worry that the _sign function in master branch has a different connotation than _sign in nist-branch? _sign in master outputs just the digest, _sign in nist-branch outputs the message and digest combined. It's true that the verification functions are named differently (_verify in master, _sign_open in nist-branch), but the signing functions have the same name. Perhaps we should rename one of them so they are distinct (maybe call nist-branch _sign_combined?).

comment.body: I might be able to find some time to work on this over the weekend.  Are you in the middle of this?

issue.title: Shared library support added
issue.body:
Once the following errors are resolved shared library will be built fine.

Locally the build can be tested with shared library by:

./configure  --disable-kex-sidh-msr; make clean; make -j8; make test 

Static library can be tested by:

./configure  LDFLAGS="-static" --disable-kex-sidh-msr; make clean; make -j8; make test 

src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P503/P503.c:22: multiple definition of `p503'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P503/P503.c:22: first defined here
src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P503/P503.c:24: multiple definition of `p503p1'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P503/P503.c:24: first defined here
src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P503/P503.c:26: multiple definition of `p503x2'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P503.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P503/P503.c:26: first defined here
src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P751/P751.c:22: multiple definition of `p751'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P751/P751.c:22: first defined here
src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P751/P751.c:24: multiple definition of `p751p1'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P751/P751.c:24: first defined here
src/kem/sike/.libs/libkemsike.a(libkemsike_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kem/sike/P751/P751.c:26: multiple definition of `p751x2'
src/kex_sidh_msr/.libs/libsidhmsr.a(libsidhmsr_la-P751.o):/home/s24mishra/workspace/alt_liboqs/liboqs/src/kex_sidh_msr/P751/P751.c:26: first defined here
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:628: recipe for target 'liboqs.la' failed

comment.body:
Looking at this list, the only ones that I think we would want to consider part of our public API are:
```
OQS_MEM_cleanse
OQS_MEM_secure_free
OQS_MEM_insecure_free
OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init
```

Some of the `OQS_RAND_` ones will be removed as part of #389.  All of the AES stuff should definitely not be part of the public API.  How can we manage this?

issue.title: Change SIG algorithm identifier on master to a string
issue.body:
Following approach on nist-branch.

Also, should we worry that the _sign function in master branch has a different connotation than _sign in nist-branch? _sign in master outputs just the digest, _sign in nist-branch outputs the message and digest combined. It's true that the verification functions are named differently (_verify in master, _sign_open in nist-branch), but the signing functions have the same name. Perhaps we should rename one of them so they are distinct (maybe call nist-branch _sign_combined?).

comment.body: Yes, I'm almost done with a big refactoring; essentially migrating a lot of code from the nist-branch. I still have some finishing touches to complete. I'm dealing with a sick kid today, so I'll be delayed a bit, but I'm hoping to work on this tonight and over the weekend. Depending on how it's going, I might hand off the baton to you if you have free time over the weekend...
